programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: NFL Events
programme.desc: Former NFL linebacker and Super Bowl champion Scott Fujita traces his family history in the U.S. back to Japanese internment during World War II. While he and his father find reconciliation in what happened, they also discover the unlikeliest of football stories.

programme.title: NFL 360
programme.desc: 3 players risk their lives, NFL hopeful transforms, Joshua Dobbs forms bond with cancer survivor.

programme.title: NFL Mic'd Up
programme.desc: The best on-field sounds from the week, with players and coaches wired for sound.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Heinicke ad-libbed a 30-yard touchdown pass to J.D. McKissic with 33 seconds remaining, rallying the Washington Football Team to a 34-30 victory over the Atlanta Falcons on Sunday.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Chase McLaughlin's 30-yard OT field goal lifted the Buccaneers to a 26-23 win over the Panthers, tying for first in the NFC South. Baker Mayfield overcame an injury scare, and Mike Evans shined with 118 yards.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Browns running back Nick Chubb scored a 2-yard, go-ahead touchdown with 57 seconds left, and Steelers quarterback Russell Wilson's Hail Mary attempt was batted down in the end zone as time expired as Cleveland wins in the snow 24-19 over Pittsburgh.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Justin Herbert threw for two touchdowns and set the franchise single-season record, and the Chargers beat the Broncos, 34-13.

programme.title: Going Global
programme.desc: Justin Jefferson was an NFL ambassador in Brazil, with soccer great Vinicius Jr. as his tour guide.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Saquon Barkley scored three touchdowns Friday night in the first NFL game in Sao Paulo, Brazil and led the Eagles to a 34-29 victory over the Green Bay Packers, who lost quarterback Jordan Love to an injury in the closing seconds.

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 3
programme.desc: They’re on the bubble in the European Poker Tour Main Event. The next six players to be eliminated will leave with nothing. The rest will be guaranteed a slice of the €9.5m prize pool. Can YouTube star Wolfgang Poker and Canadian pro Griffin Benger make it into the money? (3/11)

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 4
programme.desc: At the European Poker Tour’s 20th anniversary celebrations, there’s a throwback vibe in the Main Event. A player calling himself ‘The Eliminator’ is holding court at the feature table. Expect banter and bluffs, as this old school character competes for the €1.5m first prize. (4/11)

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 3
programme.desc: They’re on the bubble in the European Poker Tour Main Event. The next six players to be eliminated will leave with nothing. The rest will be guaranteed a slice of the €9.5m prize pool. Can YouTube star Wolfgang Poker and Canadian pro Griffin Benger make it into the money? (3/11)

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 4
programme.desc: At the European Poker Tour’s 20th anniversary celebrations, there’s a throwback vibe in the Main Event. A player calling himself ‘The Eliminator’ is holding court at the feature table. Expect banter and bluffs, as this old school character competes for the €1.5m first prize. (4/11)

programme.title: 2024 Truist Championship - Final Round
programme.desc: Watch the 2024 Truist Championship, where Rory McIlroy won at Quail Hollow Club for the fourth time.

programme.title: 2021 Truist Championship - Sunday
programme.desc: Watch the 2021 Truist Championship, where Rory McIlroy ended an 18-month drought for his 19th PGA TOUR victory.

programme.title: PGA TOUR Backspin
programme.desc: Watch the latest highlights from the best players in the world from courses around the PGA TOUR.

programme.title: The CUT
programme.desc: Get to know U.S. Ryder Cup Captain Keegan Bradley, Scottie Scheffler's win at THE CJ CUP Byron Nelson.

programme.title: Matt McCarty Wins the Black Desert Championship
programme.desc: PGA TOUR Rookie Matt McCarty wins the inaugural 2024 Black Desert Championship. McCarty was competing in just his second PGA TOUR event after receiving a promotion for winning three times on the Korn Ferry Tour this season.

programme.title: Patton Kizzire wins Procore Championship
programme.desc: Patton Kizzire claims his third PGA TOUR title after winning the 2024 Procore Championship. Kizzire shot rounds of 66-65-67-70 to finish 20-under.

programme.title: Scottie Scheffler Wins TOUR Championship
programme.desc: Scottie Scheffler captures the FedExCup trophy with his win at the 2024 TOUR Championship. This is Scheffler's seventh PGA TOUR victory of the season and 13th career win.

programme.title: Peter Malnati Wins 2024 Valspar Championship
programme.desc: Peter Malnati captures his second career victory after winning the 2024 Valspar Championship. Malnati's last win came at the 2015 Sanderson Farms Championship.

programme.title: Chris Gotterup Wins Myrtle Beach Classic
programme.desc: Chris Gotterup captures his first PGA TOUR victory after his win at the 2024 Myrtle Beach Classic. Gotterup shot rounds of 66-64-65-67 to finish 22-under to win the inaugural event.

programme.title: PGA Tour Originals

programme.title: Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show
programme.desc: Welcome back to episode #15 of the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show on TLN! The field is set! Did Army get hosed? Did Ohio State get hosed based on their draw? While CJ Kirst going #1 was no surprise, there were some names that took longer to come off the board than expected. The boys name their All-Star, Sleeper, and Snub from this years 2025 PLL Draft.

The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene makes a decision about her trip to Hawaii, leading to a heated encounter with Barb; Becky gives a presentation on addiction to Mark's class.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Two proposals bring big changes to the Conner family; Jackie uses her Jeopardy infamy to her advantage.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners continue to deal with the pandemic while navigating breakups and newfound sobriety, all while planning an upcoming wedding.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Ben declines Darlene's proposal, she starts to ponder why she tends to be so negative in life, prompting her to start a journey of self-discovery, which leads to Pastor Phil.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Part of Becky's recovery program mandates she make amends with people she has lied to over the years, leading her to meet up again with a former high school friend.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Dan and Louise's wedding day, but it's a far-from-perfect, especially when a weather report forecasts that a tornado is headed for Lanford creating chaos and surprises.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners are ready for Halloween, despite a leaky roof that forces Dan and Louise to cancel their honeymoon

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene worries about Mark making friends at his new school; Mark turns to Ben for advice; Becky finds herself thriving in college and starts thinking about her future plans.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie devises an offbeat plan to serve the customers at The Lunch Box, it's anything but smooth; Dan begins to sell furniture to make room for his new bride and her things.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Louise starts to move in, Dan decides to sell the furniture he bought for Roseanne when they were married; he soon finds parting with the furniture harder than he thought.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene brings Nick to the hardware store, where they run into Ben, who invites Nick to join him at The Lunch Box to watch a Bears game.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners celebrate Mark when he makes Dean's List at his new magnet school; Jackie continues to navigate her relationship with Neville.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene continues to navigate her breakup with Ben; Dan offers to talk with Aldo's dad when he doesn't approve of Harris and Aldo's relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark returns to public school and finds it hard to fit in; Darlene isn't happy when she finds out what Mark's doing to make extra cash for college.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene loves the house she's looking at, but when the realtor says she has a chance of getting the house if she's part of a couple, she convinces Ben to pretend to be her partner.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The family is locked down in their home due to a shooting incident in the neighborhood.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky outs her relationship with Professor Davis, it's his erratic behavior that sends Becky down a path to reevaluate their relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene searches for a home that she and Becky can afford; after an attempt to boost business at The Lunch Box goes awry.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan enlists a few friends to help him with the funeral home remodel; Robin and Darlene take a big career risk.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to cope with the stress of construction; Lou returns as Mark's contrabassoon teacher.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Ben and Darlene are excited to share their good news with the family, but Neville and Jackie, and Aldo and Harris, share their own very similar news.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners gear up for a megawedding; Jackie & Neville, Darlene & Ben, Harris & Aldo are planning for a big day, but discover that some of the couples may not be on the same page.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: In an effort to save money, Darlene and Ben, and Jackie and Neville head off on their joint honeymoon, where their cost-saving measures contribute to a tension-filled getaway.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Jackie moves in with Neville, he shows up to their home with an excess of animals from his vet office; Darlene and Ben argue Darlene is turning into her father.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is anxious to get his driver's license; Darlene attempts to teach Mark to drive, but her frantic energy sends him running to Ben for help; Harris meets a new guy online.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When a relative passes away unexpectedly, the family must debate about who should gain custody of a jaded nephew, who is just shy of his 18th birthday.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Problems arise on Beverly Rose's first day of kindergarten; Becky and Darlene have a disagreement.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris takes a stand on an issue that ruffles a few feathers in Darlene's new neighborhood.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene receives a promotion, but she quickly learns the fancy title is not all it's cracked up to be; when Louise loses her job at Casita Bonita, an opportunity arises.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie must come to terms with her mother becoming ill; Darlene's job hunt proves to be more difficult than anticipated.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene, Ben, Becky and Beverly Rose move into the new house, where Darlene implements a new set of rules.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan meets his in-laws for the first time when Louise's family comes to visit; Darlene helps Becky with a parenting problem.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The death of a beloved teacher from Dan and Jackie's high school brings old classmates together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene and Ben get into a fight and ignore Becky's boundaries in the house; Dan accuses Jackie of losing all of their home videos.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene has issues with Dan's plumbing work in her new house; Jackie tries to find a caregiver for Bev.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene continues her search for a new job; Becky is desperate to spend more time with Beverly Rose.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris makes a big announcement; Ben is overwhelmed with family responsibilities.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris takes her anger out on Darlene; Dan and Louise spend an entire day in bed together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark fights for a spot in the Lanford High chamber orchestra; Jackie puts a lottery machine in the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan and Jackie take a road trip to a hardware wholesaler in Oklahoma; Darlene heads out of town and leaves behind a plethora of to-do notes for Becky and Ben.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Louise gets into a feud with Becky after accidentally sending a rude message in the family text thread.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene figures out a plan to afford Mark's college tuition; Jackie and Louise try to help Becky meet a guy.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Neville confronts Jackie about loaning Dan money; Darlene attempts to play matchmaker for Mark.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Mark's graduation approaches, he considers his relationship with his father; Louise plans a big graduation ceremony at the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie faces problems at the Lunch Box and must take advice from an unexpected guest.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky introduces Tyler to Beverly Rose, but she is skeptical of Tyler’s approach.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Bev experiences moments of clarity and reflection and asks Jackie to spend the day together in Chicago.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark adjusts to his first day of college as a commuter student.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene crashes Mark’s college trivia night to prove how smart she is.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene urges Ben to make some male friends as he feels anxious about turning 50.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The hardware store suffers a smash and grab and Dan and Jackie hold one of the culprits.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene seeks to be manager of food services at Mark’s college after feeling they could use some organization.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners relish national cheeseball day. Harris falls behind in her work at the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan is asked to write an article for a Hardware magazine, making Ben miss his days as a writer.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A fire at Ben’s hardware store causes a major setback for the family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan achieves a major financial milestone, reconsidering his belief in the ‘Conners curse.’

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark takes on odd jobs, determined to find a way to pay for school.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A sudden turn of events forces the Conners to face their daily struggles in a way they never have before.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene is in for one surprise after another when David introduces his girlfriend, Blue (Juliette Lewis), and mentions that Mark and Harris will be spending the weekend with them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Halloween, the favorite time of year for the Conners, but an email from the school banning certain costumes, including Mark's, sets off an argument between Dan and Darlene.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Geena learns D.J. hasn't been taking Mary to church while she's been away, so she insists they go as a family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A family member drops a life-changing announcement; Dan suspects that Becky isn't sticking to her end of the deal about her drinking; Darlene continues her job search.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: With Mark and Mary's help, Jackie convinces Dan to build a chicken coop so the family can eat organic eggs.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan questions Peter's motives when he learns about the pricey Christmas gift Jackie bought for her new unemployed beau. Elsewhere, Mark and Mary write up their Christmas wish list.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky helps Harris keep a secret from Darlene, it causes a split between the two sisters.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Dan gets injured on the job covering D.J.'s vending machine route, the choice to sue the company could lead to D.J. getting fired.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Ben offers Mark free piano lessons, Darlene finds this as an opportunity to test his parenting skills. Meanwhile, Jackie throws Becky a baby shower.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Darlene grapples with a life-altering offer, a conversation with David turns her world more upside-down.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Emilio's deportation, Jackie takes on a paternal role crafting a birth plan for Becky; Darlene navigates a love triangle with David and Ben; Harris faces her own dilemma.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to decide between David and Ben; Becky begins to doubt herself as a mom; Mark gets in trouble at school when a picture of him and his boyfriend kissing goes viral

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris confronts Darlene's lifestyle; Jackie meddles in others' affairs to evade her own issues; Becky struggles with the expenses of parenthood, her family lends support.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Teenage Strangler" (1964) Horror. There's a high-school killer on the loose.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Teenagers From Outer Space" (1959) Science fiction. Alien teens with ray guns land on Earth to breed their lobsterlike space cattle. With David Love, Dawn Anderson, Harvey B. Dunn.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Project Moonbase" (1953) Science fiction. The president is a woman and so is the captain of a lunar space station in the year 1970. With Donna Martell, Hayden Rorke, Ross Ford.

programme.title: Cinematic Titanic
programme.desc: Rogue rattlesnakes attack two young boys in the Southwestern desert, and things go downhill from there.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "First Spaceship on Venus" (1960) Science fiction. International astronauts go to Venus and find what's left of a race that destroyed itself. With Yoko Tani, Oldrich Lukes, Ignacy Machowski.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Corpse Vanishes" (1942) Horror. A mad botanist drains kidnapped brides to keep his 80-year-old wife looking young. With Bela Lugosi, Luana Walters, Elizabeth Russell.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Giant Gila Monster" (1959) Science fiction. A teenage hot rodder and his buddies meet a big lizard that eats trees. With Don Sullivan, Lisa Simone, Shug Fisher.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: The crew stages their own moon landing pageant as they watch the film Moon Zero Two (1969) about an astronaut hired to capture an asteroid made of sapphires.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Manos, Hands of Fate" (1966) Horror. A family driving through Texas asks a cult master for directions.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Santa Claus" (1959) Fantasy. Santa and Merlin save kids from the devil.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Mike and the Bots watch 1961s "Bloodlust"; Dr. Forrester's deranged mother comes for a visit.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Night of the Blood Beast" (1958) Cult. An astronaut returns full of monster embryos; with Michael Emmett, Angela Greene, John Baer.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: “B” movie seems too generous a term for this one — is there such a thing as a “Z” movie? Rondo Hatton plays a disfigured man, a/k/a “The Creeper,” who hunts down and kills the people responsible for his deformity.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Deathstalker and the Warriors From Hell" a k a "Deathstalker III" (1989) Fantasy. A medieval hero (John Allen Nelson) meets twin princesses (Carla Herd) on a diamond quest.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Escape 2000" (1985) science fiction. Newswoman and Bronx warrior vs. borough exterminator; with Mark Gregory, Henry Silva, Valeria D'Obici.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Laserblast" (1978) Science fiction. A teen finds a laser gun and pendant left by aliens, who watch.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Giant Spider Invasion" (1975) Cult. Scientist and girlfriend spy car-size mutant spiders; with Steve Brodie, Barbara Hale.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.desc: The contestants live and train like marines at Camp Pendleton.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Think outside the to-go box.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: After a tough elimination challenge, the Top 12 junior home cooks face their next task when the judges test their senses in a blind taste challenge. Each contestant will blindly taste a dish prepared by Gordon Ramsay and then must recreate the dish. The contestant with the dish that best reflects Gordon’s dish will receive a significant advantage. In the next team challenge, the junior home cooks will prepare VIP dishes for a dining room of all grandmothers for their first restaurant challenge. Each team will create a unique dish of “new” ingredients and the team with the most votes will be safe from elimination. Find out who will move on to the Top 10 and who will leave.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In the next team challenge, the junior home cooks will face an egg-cellent challenge and compete in pairs to see who can complete the most deviled eggs in 12 minutes. The team that perfects the most deviled eggs will be safe from the next elimination challenge, in which contestants must create their future cookbook’s signature dish. In the second hour, Christina Tosi brings a special guest into the MASTERCHEF kitchen, her mom, to present the next mystery box challenge, which will feature all of Christina’s favorite childhood foods. Then, contestants will compete in a tag team platter challenge using international street food ingredients.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: In Anaheim, California, Chef Ramsay performs an extreme makeover on Luigi's. The Italian eatery faces management conflicts after the owner retires and leaves the business to his sons.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: Austinês El Greco is in dire need of an update. Chef Ramsay tries to maintain the ownersê traditions while modernizing the space and improving the quality of the service.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The remaining contestants take on steak. Ramsay, along with Omaha Steaks owners Bruce and Todd Simon, judge the meals based on appearance and eat them only if they look favorable.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The chefs serve forty "glampers,” who vote to determine their favorite. The victor goes glamping in Los Angeles for a night; the losers spruce up the Hollywood Hills.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The seven remaining cooks compete in their next Mystery Box Challenge using three basic utensils to prepare two dishes.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's third programme is Momma Cherri's Soul Food Shack, an intimate forty-seater a stone's throw from Brighton's sea front. Big soul momma, owner Charita Jones, produces a menu of irresistibly unique classics from the Deep South. The food's hard to fault but the punters are nowhere to be seen, Head Chef Brian and a rag-tag collection of part-timers are taking the mickey - and despite working a seven-day week Charita's got an empty restaurant and a ~£65,000 debt.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty is planting bulbs in pots and around the garden for an explosion of spring colour. Carol Klein travels to Yorkshire where she takes a close look at the enormous colour range and form of a late season perennial, the salvia. Mark Lane is in Oxfordshire looking at how ornamental grasses can be used in planting design to create exciting combinations.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After an extraordinary season, Monty's orchard has a bountiful harvest of apples and he gives advice on how to pick and store them. Frances Tophill makes a final visit to her shared allotment and joins in with the festivities at their annual show. Adam Frost visits the RHS garden Wisley where he meets the Curator to discuss the effects of summer. Nick Bailey investigates knotweed, one of the most pernicious weeds in the UK, Arit Anderson provides inspiration for colourful late season containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty tackles three seasons of gardening when he makes additions to his spring garden, gives advice on how to dry and preserve herbs for winter and plants up a container to give interest from now until spring. Carol celebrates one of the plant successes of an extraordinary summer, the Canna while Frances Tophill tackles a viewer's garden and suggests plants which will perform throughout the winter. Toby Buckland visits a garden in Devon with Japanese influences.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the cottage garden, Monty is moving a rose which has outgrown its space and in the vegetable garden he gives advice on what to plant now for spring. He also finds out more about the mysterious world of earthworms and discovers why they are vital for the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As summer unfolds at Longmeadow, Monty Don undertakes timely tasks in his vegetable garden and flower beds. Meanwhile, Carol Klein enjoys the beauty of one of our unsung native flowers, the geum, and visits a cottage garden which holds the national collection of cultivated forms. Plus, Formula 1 supremo Sir Frank Williams explains why he is opening his garden at Inholmes.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first signs of spring herald the start of the new gardening year. Monty Don reveals the changes he has made to his garden over the winter, tackles timely pruning tasks and shows the best way to lay a new path. Meanwhile, snowdrops are lighting up the winter garden and Carol Klein is out and about in Oxfordshire celebrating their staggering diversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets to work in his wildlife garden to ensure that there are plenty of plants in flower for early pollinators. Carol Klein meets Stuart Donachie who has embraced every planting opportunity in his shady garden in Herefordshire, and Frances Tophill invites viewers to grow easy summer vegetables along with her as she trials varieties for taste and productivity at RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: British summer time means that, from Saturday, we all have an extra hour to get out in our gardens in the evenings just as the early spring display is coming into its own. At Longmeadow, Monty Don introduces us to the coppice, a woodland area where his favourite flower, the primrose, is in bloom. As well as enjoying the seasonal colours of spring, it's time to plan the summer display. Monty sows sweet peas.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team return with a celebration of spring. There's been plenty going on over the winter and lots of new projects in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential rose pruning, Monty plants clematis and rocket, cuts back grasses and makes a start on sowing annuals for colour this summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As plants begin to show their early growth, Monty gets plenty of plants for free when he demonstrates how to make the most of herbaceous perennials. He also cuts back pelargoniums that have overwintered in the greenhouse and makes a start on sowing vegetables. Nick Bailey shares plans for his new garden in Northamptonshire and shows how to create a container garden ideal for those on the move. Frances Tophill discovers more ways to use cut flowers as she visits a florist in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don grows a plant he's never tried before, loofahs. He also celebrates some of his favourite tulip combinations and plants out crocosmia. Joe Swift visits a garden, created by an award-winning designer.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals plans for a new raised seating area, surrounded by wild flowers. Carol looks at the blossom at Battsford Arboretum in the Cotswolds and now the risk of frosts should have passed, Monty plants beans and courgettes in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As part of his planning for summer Monty begins to sow annual climbers and gets started on tidying and mulching his borders. In the last of Joe Swift's series on trees, he learns how and when to prune them, and why. We also meet clematis enthusiast, Mike Brown, whose collection fills his garden with colour all summer long, and amongst the brutalist architecture of London's Barbican, Nick Bailey, head gardener of the Chelsea Physic Garden, discovers a hidden tropical oasis.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As usual, Monty is at Longmeadow where he will set out his plans for the coming year. Monty reviews the effects the winter weather has had on his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty is planting bulbs in pots and around the garden for an explosion of spring colour. Carol Klein travels to Yorkshire where she takes a close look at the enormous colour range and form of a late season perennial, the salvia. Mark Lane is in Oxfordshire looking at how ornamental grasses can be used in planting design to create exciting combinations.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Featuring advice on how to plant spring flowering perennials for instant impact and recommendations for planting bare root roses full of fragrance in borders and pots. Monty will also begin planning the vegetable garden for the year ahead.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As spring approaches, it's time to get going with sowing seeds and Monty recommends varieties to sow now for months of summer colour. With conifers enjoying a revival, he also plants up a pot to give interest all year round.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Monty away for a week, Adam Frost presents from his own garden in Cambridgeshire and gets to grips with planting up his gravel garden with spring colour, sows some unusual vegetables and starts work on a new project. Carol Klein is in Surrey where she is in the midst of a dazzling display of thousands of tulips.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty plants out his tomatoes, continues work in his paradise garden, and reveals plans for a new project. In Peterborough, a city garden with a lack of space has not proved a problem for a couple who have created a woodland garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty turns his attention to the pond at Longmeadow. He adds a splash of colour to the planting with some perennial springtime favourites, as well as giving advice on pond maintenance which can be carried out without disturbing wildlife.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the growing season picks up a pace, Monty is sowing vegetables and planting out the scented plants, which he brought back from the Malvern Spring Festival. Carol is delving into the hedgerows and rooting at the bases of walls, fences and trees as she begins her journey to investigate why plants thrive in challenging conditions. We also return to Sissinghurst to find out about the changes Troy Scott-Smith is making to the world famous white garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at RHS Garden Wisley in Surrey to learn from the experts there how easy alpines are to grow, which seeds are needed to plant a wildflower meadow and the best orchids to grow for each room in the house. Meanwhile, Carol Klein helps Britain in Bloom volunteer Michael Welsh, who is determined to bring colour to the former colliery town of Easington with a community garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Earlier in the year Monty put aside a patch of his garden to grow his own cut flowers and this week he returns to assess the results and harvest his first crop of colourful blooms. We pay a visit to an organic flower farm to find out how, from seed to harvest, the process of growing plays a large part in improving well-being.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don, Joe Swift and Carol Klein go behind the scenes at the Malvern Spring Gardening Show. While Monty takes a sneak peak at the floral marquee before the show opens, Carol hunts for rare and unusual plants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is planning ahead and planting autumn-flowering crocus at Longmeadow. Also for autumn colour, he's adding cyclamen to the spring garden, and has tips on how to get a great show from them. Meanwhile, Joe Swift visits Marks Hall - a surprising but inspiring modern garden and Carol Klein is in Staffordshire with a couple who've created a garden for all seasons in their half-acre plot.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty is planning for next summer by sowing a batch of sweet peas. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is amongst the leaves, bark and berries at Thorp Perrow Arboretum in Yorkshire admiring the onset of the autumn display. Plus, there's a visit to Ryton Gardens in Warwickshire to find out about their collection of heritage vegetables and how to collect their seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has got advice on taking cuttings from favourite roses to bulk up stock for free. He is also sowing in the vegetable garden now for a winter salad harvest right up until Christmas, and planning ahead and planting a beautiful display of narcissi and foxgloves to enjoy next spring and summer. Meanwhile, Carol Kelin is at Glebe Cottage collecting seeds from her favourite flowering perennials.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets to work in his wildlife garden to ensure that there are plenty of plants in flower for early pollinators. Carol Klein meets Stuart Donachie who has embraced every planting opportunity in his shady garden in Herefordshire, and Frances Tophill invites viewers to grow easy summer vegetables along with her as she trials varieties for taste and productivity at RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty demonstrates that it is not too late to start growing vegetables by showing us which types to sow now, and adds some summer colour to the Spring Garden by sinking plants in pots into the borders. We meet a hosta National Collection holder, who shares the secrets of his propagating success, and Rachel de Thame pays a visit to the garden of theatre impresario Sir Cameron Mackintosh.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don demonstrates how to prepare for spring and summer with timely tasks in his damp garden and around the pond, and Joe Swift continues his series of master classes on planting design by sharing tips on how to create a tropical green oasis. Elsewhere, Carol Klein plants a viburnum that will give spring colour and fill her Devon garden with fragrance.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has advice on how to successfully store an apple crop so it will last through winter and explains why he thinks it high time wall flowers came back into fashion. With tomatoes now over, Monty clears his greenhouse and plans for next year by planting garlic in the vegetable garden. Meanwhile, Carol is home at Glebe Cottage, dividing her perennials to continue the cost-effective stocking of her new beds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets his new vegetable garden underway by making raised beds. He also offers advice on how to cut back herbs. Nick Bailey marks the 400th anniversary of the death of William Shakespeare when he investigates the fact and the fiction behind the Bard's potions and poisons, at the Chelsea Physic Garden; and we visit Pashley Manor in East Sussex to unearth the story behind the planting of over 25,000 tulips.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Across the country `Gardeners' World' presenters, from their own gardens and homes, give advice and share their knowledge to enable people to get the most out of their gardens. For further inspiration, professionals, horticulturists and hobby gardeners provide fellow green-fingered enthusiasts with useful tips and suggestions, no matter the size of garden or level of expertise. Whether it is creating depth in a small, backyard garden or how to make the most of the latest spinach crop with homemade pesto, presenters prove that the possibilities are endless for any gardener and garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As April gets under way, Monty Don begins the process of reinvigorating his Jewel Garden where, over the coming months, he will be using plants which will give an evolving tapestry of colour over the seasons. Elsewhere, Carol Klein revels in the glory of one the world's most renowned camellia collections when she visits Mount Edgcumbe on the banks of the River Tamar in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Spring gets into its stride and Longmeadow is bursting into life. Monty Don prepares for the summer by direct sowing hardy annuals like nasturtiums and calendulas as well as planting barley to give a flush of golden colour in the summer months. Monty also introduces us to the walled garden, an intimate family space where he'll be doing some timely lawn repair. Carol Klein visits the Gibberd Garden in Harlow.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As usual, Monty is at Longmeadow where he will set out his plans for the coming year. Monty reviews the effects the winter weather has had on his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As spring gets well underway, Monty Don adds to his collection of fritillaries at Longmeadow with pot-grown plants, as well as sowing some from seed. He also recommends other wildflowers which would thrive in the garden. Carol Klein meets Matt Bishop, who explains why he is attracted to later flowering varieties of daffodils and Rachel de Thame shows a viewer how to get to grips with pruning an overgrown shrubbery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With bees in mind, Monty Don plans for spring by planting some early nectar sources for them, using bulbs which flower early in the year, namely crocus and winter aconites. He also selects some asters which will not only give colour for autumn but will also help bees build up their nectar reserves to help them survive the winter. Plus, Carol Klein is in Norfolk at Pensthorpe Nature Reserve.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first signs of spring herald the start of the new gardening year. Monty Don reveals the changes he has made to his garden over the winter, tackles timely pruning tasks and shows the best way to lay a new path. Meanwhile, snowdrops are lighting up the winter garden and Carol Klein is out and about in Oxfordshire celebrating their staggering diversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don, Joe Swift and Carol Klein go behind the scenes at the Malvern Spring Gardening Show. While Monty takes a sneak peak at the floral marquee before the show opens, Carol hunts for rare and unusual plants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows us how to plant pots of bulbs for fabulous summer colour. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is out and about looking at native celandines, Wordsworth's favourite flower. They grace our hedgerows and woods at this time of year. The wild strains are too invasive for most domestic gardens, but Carol finds a number of cultivated varieties that should suit most of us.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: British summer time means that, from Saturday, we all have an extra hour to get out in our gardens in the evenings just as the early spring display is coming into its own. At Longmeadow, Monty Don introduces us to the coppice, a woodland area where his favourite flower, the primrose, is in bloom. As well as enjoying the seasonal colours of spring, it's time to plan the summer display. Monty sows sweet peas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the growing season picks up a pace, Monty is sowing vegetables and planting out the scented plants, which he brought back from the Malvern Spring Festival. Carol is delving into the hedgerows and rooting at the bases of walls, fences and trees as she begins her journey to investigate why plants thrive in challenging conditions. We also return to Sissinghurst to find out about the changes Troy Scott-Smith is making to the world famous white garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is planning ahead and planting autumn-flowering crocus at Longmeadow. Also for autumn colour, he's adding cyclamen to the spring garden, and has tips on how to get a great show from them. Meanwhile, Joe Swift visits Marks Hall - a surprising but inspiring modern garden and Carol Klein is in Staffordshire with a couple who've created a garden for all seasons in their half-acre plot.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Earlier in the year Monty put aside a patch of his garden to grow his own cut flowers and this week he returns to assess the results and harvest his first crop of colourful blooms. We pay a visit to an organic flower farm to find out how, from seed to harvest, the process of growing plays a large part in improving well-being.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty demonstrates that it is not too late to start growing vegetables by showing us which types to sow now, and adds some summer colour to the Spring Garden by sinking plants in pots into the borders. We meet a hosta National Collection holder, who shares the secrets of his propagating success, and Rachel de Thame pays a visit to the garden of theatre impresario Sir Cameron Mackintosh.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty is planning for next summer by sowing a batch of sweet peas. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is amongst the leaves, bark and berries at Thorp Perrow Arboretum in Yorkshire admiring the onset of the autumn display. Plus, there's a visit to Ryton Gardens in Warwickshire to find out about their collection of heritage vegetables and how to collect their seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first big gardening weekend of the year gets underway with Monty dividing perennials and giving plenty of tips for how we can kick-start the garden for the season ahead. As millions of bedding plants are poised for planting in our pots and borders, Joe Swift visits a major grower to find out how they are produced and what drives the demand.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets going on a new project when he starts planting a colour-themed, fragrant border and he has tips on successional planting in the vegetable garden. Nick Bailey begins his ultimate guide to growing clematis, while Arit Anderson visits a new, free, public roof garden in London.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Broncos, Galaxies and a lifted Grand Wagoneer
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds all sorts of interesting vehicles on a trip to Northern Michigan, from Ford Broncos to a unique Ford Galaxie. Speaking of Galaxies, hang around for a look at a Galaxie 500 that is back on the road after being a "barn find" itself!

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | RARE: Dan Gurney's Chevy Impala Returned to the Family After 63 Years
programme.desc: Tom and Justin Gurney unveil a long-lost 1961 Impala.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture with Larry Chen
programme.desc: Tony Stark of the Italian Automotive World: Luca Betti of Kimera Automobili

programme.title: The Next Big Thing with Magnus Walker | Jaguar XJS and Vintage Wagons
programme.desc: Urban Outlaw Magnus Walker drives a Jaguar XJS and some vintage long-roof wagons. Follow along as he makes the argument as to why these vehicles might be The Next Big Thing in the collector car world

programme.title: The Appraiser | 1969 COPO Camaro, 1969 Mustang Mach 1, and a 1969 Z/28 Camaro RS
programme.desc: Colin Comer starts this episode out with an original 1969 double COPO Camaro before moving onto a well-driven and well-loved 1969 Ford Mustang Mach 1. To wrap things up, Colin appraises a well-documented 1969 Chevy Camaro Z/28 "DZ-code."

programme.title: The Appraiser | All about Ford Mustangs!
programme.desc: Colin Comer appraises a trio of interesting Ford Mustangs. A 1993 Ford SVT Cobra, 1966 Shelby GT350 Hertz edition, and a 1966 Mustang with 350,000 miles on the odometer!

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Lamborghini Miura and the original Acura NSX
programme.desc: This episode of Revelations with Jason Cammisa features the stories behind the Lamborghini Miura and the original Acura NSX

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Needle in a Haystack: 1 of 3 remaining F100 Sleeping Bear Dunesmobile Will it Run
programme.desc: Tom finds one of the last remaing "Dunesmobiles" Ford F-100 trucks

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Resurrecting rare Fords, and an incredible Shelby Cobra story
programme.desc: Tom Cotter begins this episode with a 29-year old who is "living the dream" resurrecting rare, old Fords. After that, Tom has the unique opportunity to see Herbie Hancock's Shelby Cobra that the famous musician has owned since new.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Lifetime collection of cars leaves Tom speechless
programme.desc: Tom visits his old friend Dave Coleman who has collected many more "barn finds" on his property since Tom last saw him. Get a tour of Dave's property that's filled with interesting and rare cars.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole's EXCLUSIVE on the GMA T.50 and McLaren F1

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Will the faded paint on this dusty Ford Wagon shine like new?
programme.desc: Tom Cotter explores a property Midland, Texas, absolutely filled with old cars. An old Ford wagon catches his eye and Tom attempts to cut through the sun-faded, dust-covered quarter panel to reveal its former glory.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole drives and reviews the Aston Martin Valkyrie

programme.title: The Appraiser | 1969 COPO Camaro, 1969 Mustang Mach 1, and a 1969 Z/28 Chevy Camaro RS
programme.desc: Colin Comer starts this episode out with an original 1969 double COPO Camaro before moving onto a well-driven and well-loved 1969 Ford Mustang Mach 1. Next, Colin appraises a 1969 Chevrolet Camaro Z/28.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Autozam AZ-1, Honda Beat, Suzuki Cappuccino, and Honda S500

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Forgotten warehouse full of cars must go!
programme.desc: Forgotten warehouse full of cars must go!

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole visits the McLaren Technology Centre to discuss the McLaren W1 with Chris Harrison, Vehicle Integration Director and Deputy Chief Technical Officer, McLaren Automotive.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | The Lancia Delta S4 Stradale and a Lotus Elise restomod
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole drives one his dream cars, the Lancia Delta S4 Stradale.Next, Henry jumps in a Lotus Elise restomod that features some unique touches inspired by the legendary McLaren F1 supercar.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Two Jeep CJ 2As and Three Triumphs in ONE alley
programme.desc: Two Jeep CJ 2As and Three Triumphs in ONE alley.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Birthplace of the Barn Find
programme.desc: Birthplace of the Barn Find

programme.title: Will It Run?
programme.desc: This 1965 Chevy Corvair was totaled and eventually purchased by its current owner for $800.

programme.title: RadVentures | Defender and Range Rover off-roading, Ford F-150 Lighting racing
programme.desc: There's lots of fun to be had in these 80's and 90's icons! In this episode of RadVentures, Ryan Symancek goes offroading in a couple old Land Rovers. Next, a 700HP Ford SVT Lighting and $1500 Flareside F-150 go head-to-head on the track.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Forgotten F1 Cars, CRAZY Untold Dan Gurney Stories & Shop Tour of "AAR"

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | American Classics in Detroit and Big-block Camaros in Arizona
programme.desc: Tom Cotter discovers some amazing barn finds in Detroit, MI, including a Buick Caballero, a pair of Pontiac GTOs and a pair of Jaguar XK140s. Next, we find Tom in Arizona where he uncovers some interesting Mopars and two Big-block Chevy Camaros.

programme.title: Patrick Dempsey Returns to Racing in "Back on Track"
programme.desc: "Back on Track" takes you behind the scenes of actor Patrick Dempsey's return to racing. Joined by longtime friend and fellow Porsche driver Patrick Long, the two Patricks race in the North America Porsche Endurance Challenge.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | Corvettes vs. The World
programme.desc: We drag race the first-ever hybrid, all-wheel-drive Corvette E-Ray against two Italian Supercars: the Ferrari F8 and Lamborghini Huracan Evo RWD.After that, it's the 2023 C8 Corvette Z06 against a Porsche 992 GT3, a Ducati V4 SP2, and an Audi R8.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Tri-power Olds Super 88 and forgotten cars must GO!
programme.desc: Tom teams up with Davin Reckow, from our "Redline Rebuild" series, to unearth a large collection of forgotten classics, including an Oldsmobile Super 88 that gets a second lease on life after it's purchase and restored by a Barn Find Hunter viewer!

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Wild Ferrari Restomod and the Oft-forgotten TVR Tuscan
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the gorgeous RML SWB Ferrari 250 GT restomod before jumping into an amazing car that most people may not be familiar with: the TVR Tuscan.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Mazda RX-7s, RX-5s, RX-3s and Datsun Z-Cars

programme.title: The Hunted Land & Sea
programme.desc: With Kristian at sea, his father Kim watches close friend Gerry Holland archery hunt the home ranch for the hit list deer.

programme.title: The Hunted Land & Sea
programme.desc: Grant Ellsworth hunts the Hansen Ranch during rifle season hoping to get remaining hit list bucks “The Big Guy” in the freezer or the “Management buck” down before the rut.

programme.title: The Hunted Land & Sea

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: The Crew heads to Rivers Lodge and Hunt Club in Kansas to fish strip pits. Trenton and Rex take on Mike and Nate in a 3 period mini tournament. With multiple species allowed including northern pike, the two teams are neck and neck after the first two periods. Due to bad weather on day 2, period 3 turned into a hour speed round where only keeper largemouth count.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: From battling towering 12-foot waves in the Gulf of Alaska, to reeling in colossal 200 lb. halibut, they discover firsthand the rugged beauty of America's 49th state. This episode highlights Lindell Yachts as a top builder of rugged offshore sportfishing yachts, as well as Radon Boats as great pilothouse fishing and guide boats.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: Week 1 of the Tropic Star Inshore Seminars features guests targeting a plethora of species in the life rich waters surrounding the lodge.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: The first half Blair heads out with Greggor Dornau of Starbrite Solutions, then in the second half goes fishing with Capt. Bobby lane for bass.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: On this episode Capt. Danny joins his good buddy and talented marine artist, Stephen Ferrell. The two of them take the 27’ DekKat to fish some of Stephen’s favorite paddle-board spots here in Melbourne, Florida. Tune in and see what they can make happen on a challenging weather day seeking the elusive Snook!

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: Shot through the neck on Fort Hood in Texas, Green Beret John Arroyo recounts coming face to face with his attacker and Jesus blinding his would be killer.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: An Honor No One Wants: A Gold Star Family is the immediate family member(s) of a fallen soldier who died while serving in a time of conflict. Ginger Gilbert-Ravella honors the memory her husband…American hero Troy Gilbert.

programme.desc: Last year was chaotic but it wouldn’t be right if we didn’t try to throw a wrench into our plans once again. Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to the Dirty Bird.

programme.title: The Raven Project

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With a laundry list of things to do on the Dirty Bird, Randy finds himself in a pickle when Cody just up and disappears.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With two weeks until the opener of Missouri archery season, Randy and Cody are trying to do everything they can to have the Raven prepped for the first bow camp.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Rifle season is off to a slow start but things are heating up with lots of tags to fill.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark is still on the South Island of New Zealand chasing the Wingshooting Slam. It’s Mark's last day to complete the waterfowl portion of the slam and he still needs a Black Swan and a Shoveler. This hunt is taking place on a freshwater lake right off the ocean. The temperature is unusually warm for this time of year, but thankfully that hasn’t affected the numbers of birds around.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: Mark Peterson and his Father Earl are in Northern California hunting mountain quail, a unique species with high concentrations in Southern Oregon and Northern California. With their dogs along for this fast and furious hunt it doesn't take Mark long to bag a quail right out of the gate. Watch the rest of the episode to see if Earl is able to take down one of his own.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade gets very busy in the real estate world. But lucky for him, Caleb Armstrong takes up the slack. Caleb sets out to hunt swamp bucks on the public land of Tensas Parish.

programme.title: HUnting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his brother Tai take us around a new investment property - a 55 acre tract in Wilkinson County, MS and go over what it took to take an undesirable raw tract, to a place with multiple offers on the first day it was put on the market.
After filming his son kill his first 200″ monster, Kris Seymour chases big bucks in Kansas, Oklahoma and Canada.

programme.title: The Hunted Land & Sea
programme.desc: With Kristian at sea, his father Kim watches close friend Gerry Holland archery hunt the home ranch for the hit list deer.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield of All Things Hunting and Willi Schmidt of Pure Hunting share their personal stories of how hunting has been an integral part of their lives, passed down through generations. While their beginnings and experiences are very different, they find common ground in the heritage of Browning Firearms with memorable whitetail hunts in Louisiana and Montana.

programme.title: Turkey Posse
programme.desc: Josh Dahlke and Pete Osterman travel to Washington state from Minnesota for a run-and-gun turkey camp. They get in the game and turn up plenty of turkeys, but hunting pressure – from humans and coyotes – has the gobblers on edge.

programme.title: The Huntsman
programme.desc: Join Chris Waters, along with his friends Brad and Lynda Johnson in The Huntsman Season 2 finale as they take on the ultimate Australian hunting adventure: pursuing the mighty Water Buffalo. With their enormous size, strength, and unpredictable nature, water buffalo are one of the most dangerous game animals to hunt in Australia, making this an unforgettable experience for any hunter. The goal isn't to get the biggest trophy, but to fill the freezer.Whether you're an experienced hunter or someone dreaming of your first big game adventure, this episode provides a glimpse into one of the most thrilling hunting experiences Australia has to offer.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With a laundry list of things to do on the Dirty Bird, Randy finds himself in a pickle when Cody just up and disappears.

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: Chandler is kicking season off in KS during the early season and has to get creative to pull it off from the ground! He's familiar with the "Narrow 10" after having a great encounter with him 2 years prior. Closing this story on the Schumacher's farm was a special one with the ground strategy we put together!

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.desc: In Texas, outdoor writer Brad Fenson assesses whether or not the moon phase has an impact on his whitetail hunt where the big bucks seem to be sticking to nighttime movement.

programme.desc: An Honor No One Wants: A Gold Star Family is the immediate family member(s) of a fallen soldier who died while serving in a time of conflict. Ginger Gilbert-Ravella honors the memory her husband…American hero Troy Gilbert.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Last year was chaotic but it wouldn’t be right if we didn’t try to throw a wrench into our plans once again. Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to the Dirty Bird.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The boys are still at the Dirty bird in Oklahoma, trying to get a few more tasks done before heading back to the Raven in Missouri. They also manage to get out and do a little velvet scouting with the Hawk spotting scope.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With a laundry list of things to do on the Dirty Bird, Randy finds himself in a pickle when Cody just up and disappears.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With two weeks until the opener of Missouri archery season, Randy and Cody are trying to do everything they can to have the Raven prepped for the first bow camp.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Rifle season is off to a slow start but things are heating up with lots of tags to fill.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark is still on the South Island of New Zealand chasing the Wingshooting Slam. It’s Mark's last day to complete the waterfowl portion of the slam and he still needs a Black Swan and a Shoveler. This hunt is taking place on a freshwater lake right off the ocean. The temperature is unusually warm for this time of year, but thankfully that hasn’t affected the numbers of birds around.

programme.title: Upland Slam
programme.desc: Mark Peterson and his Father Earl are in Northern California hunting mountain quail, a unique species with high concentrations in Southern Oregon and Northern California. With their dogs along for this fast and furious hunt it doesn't take Mark long to bag a quail right out of the gate. Watch the rest of the episode to see if Earl is able to take down one of his own.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade gets very busy in the real estate world. But lucky for him, Caleb Armstrong takes up the slack. Caleb sets out to hunt swamp bucks on the public land of Tensas Parish.

programme.title: HUnting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his brother Tai take us around a new investment property - a 55 acre tract in Wilkinson County, MS and go over what it took to take an undesirable raw tract, to a place with multiple offers on the first day it was put on the market.
After filming his son kill his first 200″ monster, Kris Seymour chases big bucks in Kansas, Oklahoma and Canada.

programme.title: The Hunted Land & Sea
programme.desc: With Kristian at sea, his father Kim watches close friend Gerry Holland archery hunt the home ranch for the hit list deer.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield of All Things Hunting and Willi Schmidt of Pure Hunting share their personal stories of how hunting has been an integral part of their lives, passed down through generations. While their beginnings and experiences are very different, they find common ground in the heritage of Browning Firearms with memorable whitetail hunts in Louisiana and Montana.

programme.title: Turkey Posse
programme.desc: Josh Dahlke and Pete Osterman travel to Washington state from Minnesota for a run-and-gun turkey camp. They get in the game and turn up plenty of turkeys, but hunting pressure – from humans and coyotes – has the gobblers on edge.

programme.title: The Huntsman
programme.desc: Join Chris Waters, along with his friends Brad and Lynda Johnson in The Huntsman Season 2 finale as they take on the ultimate Australian hunting adventure: pursuing the mighty Water Buffalo. With their enormous size, strength, and unpredictable nature, water buffalo are one of the most dangerous game animals to hunt in Australia, making this an unforgettable experience for any hunter. The goal isn't to get the biggest trophy, but to fill the freezer.Whether you're an experienced hunter or someone dreaming of your first big game adventure, this episode provides a glimpse into one of the most thrilling hunting experiences Australia has to offer.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With a laundry list of things to do on the Dirty Bird, Randy finds himself in a pickle when Cody just up and disappears.

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: Chandler is kicking season off in KS during the early season and has to get creative to pull it off from the ground! He's familiar with the "Narrow 10" after having a great encounter with him 2 years prior. Closing this story on the Schumacher's farm was a special one with the ground strategy we put together!

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: In Texas, outdoor writer Brad Fenson assesses whether or not the moon phase has an impact on his whitetail hunt where the big bucks seem to be sticking to nighttime movement.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Dan Schmidt struggles with freezing Nebraska temperatures on a whitetail rut hunt in the Sandhills.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Seasoned bowhunter Bob Robb remains humble as he faces a reality that no amount of practicing can ever fully eliminate.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience

programme.title: TRP

programme.desc: Dreaming of being a famous R&B guitarist, a young virtuoso seeks out a legendary musician and must convince him to teach him the ways of the blues.

programme.title: Held Up
programme.desc: Everything changes for a bored bank teller who hates everything about his life the day two different gangs of bank robbers bust through the door.

programme.title: Perfect
programme.desc: An intrepid Rolling Stone reporter bumps up against a publicity-shy aerobics instructor while covering a sexy scoop on her Los Angeles health club.

programme.title: Desperate Measures

programme.title: Ike : Countdown to D-Day

programme.title: All the Pretty Horses

programme.title: The Walk
programme.desc: Based on the book by Philippe Petit.

programme.title: The Next Karate Kid
programme.desc: A teenage girl struggles to balance the trials of high school, the discipline of martial arts, and the thrill of her first romance.

programme.title: 50 to 1
programme.desc: A misfit group of New Mexico cowboys sets out on a life-changing journey when their racehorse qualifies for the Kentucky Derby. Based on a true story.

programme.title: Wind
